When people actually look at the data, though, they find
that we fund all of the categories that there are usually doubts
about. For example, we're the world's largest bio accelerator.
We've funded over 400 bio startups to date.
We fund startups with millions of dollars in annual revenue,
like MessageBird, who made $20 million the year before they
applied YC. We fund companies with just an idea - over a quarter
of the Summer 21 batch hadn't launched when they applied.
It can be scary to submit your startup to be assessed, but
remember that we may reject you and be wrong.
We make mistakes all the time.
We fund companies that we previously rejected
a lot. 60% of the Summer 21 batch had applied previously.
Second, rejection is part of all successful startups paths.
